image.altText: A man in a white shirt looks towards the camera.

props.synopsis: A former captain of Australia's Olympic rowing team pinned his ex-wife down while wearing black rubber gloves and had her in "fear for her life" during an assault he has pleaded guilty to, a Tasmanian court has heard.

title.children: Former Olympic rower wore 'black rubber gloves' during assault of ex-wife, court told

image.altText: Cars rush past a modern building fronted with opaque glass panels.

props.synopsis: Days after Tasmania's Liberal government cops flak over no funds being allocated to Launceston's promised heart centre in the state budget, Prime Minister Albanese announces the Federal government would foot the entire bill.

title.children: Federal government to foot entire bill for specialised heart centre in Tasmania's north

image.altText: A sign sits outside Launceston General Hospital.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Health Department will appoint a senior doctor to conduct audits of patient death records across the health system from before 2019. It follows a report in June which found 29 deaths were never referred to the coroner when they should have been.

title.children: 'We haven't got this right': Tasmania to appoint senior doctor to audit patient death records

image.altText: Shane Navin with Glenn Evans in Mazda RX7

props.synopsis: Glenn Evans has told a Hobart court of the crash that killed fellow Targa Tasmania competitor Shane Navin in 2021. An inquest is examining four deaths in three separate Targa crashes in 2021 and 2022.

title.children: 'I felt the car start to slide': Targa competitor recounts crash that killed his co-driver

image.altText: A hand holding a phone

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says there is no tsunami headed to Australia after sending a false warning to half the country earlier today.

title.children: Bureau of Meteorology says no tsunami headed for Australia after sending false watch warning

image.altText: A man in a cap and waterproof clothes leaning in to look closely at moss growing on a tree trunk with a hand lens.

props.synopsis: Des Callaghan has travelled the world photographing mosses, and describes Tasmania as a "hotspot".

title.children: Tasmania is a hotspot for mosses, those 'overlooked botanical beauties'

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day

props.synopsis: The policy that just won't quit is back. Will Labor revisit its 2016 and 2019 election policies?

title.children: We're talking about negative gearing again, but why is it such a big deal?

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: That huge slowdown in the pace of headline inflation was expected, but economists say it needs to be interpreted cautiously.

title.children: Headline inflation drops to 2.7pc, down from 3.5pc, as energy rebates kick in

image.altText: Hobart bus mall in Elizabeth Street

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government says an agreement has been finalised to roll-out a "smart" ticketing system for Tasmania's public transport network.

title.children: Did you miss? 📣 Tasmania promises 'smart' public transport payment usually reserved for major cities

image.altText: Two seconds of CCTV footage showing a woman moving a smartphone towards a man's face.

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Kikkert was disendorsed by the Liberals two weeks ago over allegations about donations and behaviour towards staff.

title.children: 'Lowest political game': Former Canberra Liberals MLA Elizabeth Kikkert defends actions after CCTV clip released

image.altText: Joe Biden stands in front of a green wall and holds up a hand.

props.synopsis: World leaders are gathering in New York this week with a growing list of conflicts and crises to discuss. Here are some takeaways from the first day of debate at the UN General Assembly.

title.children: Warned of a 'powder keg that risks engulfing the world', global leaders gather at the UN

image.altText: A drawing showing a wide path leading onto a bridge

props.synopsis: Two years ago, the Tasmanian government released concept designs for wider pathways for pedestrians and cyclists on the Tasman Bridge. Now, the government says it cannot be done without spending significantly more money than it budgeted.

title.children: Hobart's Tasman Bridge pathway widening plan scrapped, despite advocates saying existing lanes 'too narrow, too exposed, too badly designed'

image.altText: Man with grey hair and glasses, standing in front of a wall full of old photographs

props.synopsis: Richard "Dick" Caine was charged with 39 offences committed against six teenagers at the pool and in his home and car in the 1970s and '80s. A court previously heard he had terminal lung and throat cancer and was expected to have only months to live.

title.children: Sydney swim coach dies weeks after being found guilty of raping and sexually assaulting young girls

image.altText: A dead cattle's skull resting against a tree, rusty lighting

props.synopsis: Allegations of animal welfare issues and financial mismanagement have plagued the Kimberley Meat Company for nearly a decade. Now it has shut down owing $103 million.

title.children: 'Appalling': Local businesses out of pocket after abattoir shuts down owing $103 million

image.altText: A photo of missing woman Samantha Murphy in a formal floral dress.

props.synopsis: Specialist teams have searched an area riddled with undocumented mines, just kilometres from where Ms Murphy's mobile phone was found in May.

title.children: Dog squad, motorbike team join search for missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy

image.altText: Portraits of nine women looking serious are arranged in a grid.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian women who won a landmark class action settlement more than a year ago over damage done by pelvic mesh have still not received any compensation.

title.children: More than a year after their $300 million settlement, these women have still not received any money

image.altText: An older woman with blonde hair and a white blazer looks at the camera in a composite image with police officers

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation uncovers allegations of bullying, sexism and a dangerous lack of support within the ranks of NSW Police, which officers say is driving hundreds of officers out of the force.

title.children: Bullying, sexism and 'toxic' culture claims levelled at Australia's biggest police force

image.altText: Australian Made logos.

props.synopsis: It is an iconic Australian logo, but a coalition of businesses want Aussie-made logos to be made clearer after a survey finds more than half of consumers are being misled into buying foreign-owned products.

title.children: Is the kangaroo label confusing? Locally owned businesses call for clearer Australian Made labelling

image.altText: Two boys

props.synopsis: Russell and Ben Smith were found dead in their Faulconbridge home earlier this month. Their mother has since been charged with two counts of domestic violence-related murder.

title.children: 'An absolute privilege to be your father': Hundreds gather to farewell boys allegedly murdered by their mother

image.altText: A cloud of smoke over a city skyline in the background; a beach in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Israel's military said the air strikes into southern Lebanon killed a top Hezbollah commander, while Lebanon's foreign minister said the strikes killed more than 560 people and left an estimated half a million people displaced, urging the US to intervene and help halt the fighting.

title.children: Hezbollah launches its first ballistic missile strike in year-long conflict as Israel barrages Lebanon for third day

image.altText: A shot of downtown Whitesburg shows red brick buildings and cars lining a street

props.synopsis: A small US town has been rocked after a district court judge was shot and killed in his chambers. A sheriff and long-time colleague has been charged with his murder.

title.children: The case of a sheriff accused of murdering a judge in his chambers is captivating Americans

image.altText: Women in dresses standing and one lady sitting on the floor

props.synopsis: The Netflix-inspired event is drawing comparisons to the infamous Willy Wonka experience fiasco earlier this year.

title.children: Bridgerton fans paid hundreds of dollars for a themed ball in Detroit. Here's why they weren't impressed

image.altText: Sarah Klau and Olivia Tchine compete for the ball.

props.synopsis: With the series level at 1-1 and the silverware up for grabs, the world champion Diamonds face the rejuvenated Roses in Bendigo. Follow live.

title.children: Australia locked in tense encounter with England in series-deciding third Test

image.altText: Victorian Liberal leader John Pesutto, pictured outside the Federal Court in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Victorian Liberal Party leader John Pesutto admits under cross-examination that he shared names with Jeff Kennett of party members who supported expelled MP Moira Deeming.

title.children: Pesutto shared defamation case settlement details with former Liberal premier Jeff Kennett, trial hears

image.altText: Man in trucker hat holds baby while walking

props.synopsis: Matt Wright faces an eight-week trial in the NT Supreme Court next year on a charge of attempting to pervert the course of justice, with the prosecution alone expected to call more than 120 witnesses.

title.children: Netflix star Matt Wright to stand trial on charge of attempting to pervert the course of justice

image.altText: Michelle Brasier smiles in a professional portrait, wearing a sheer green top decorated with sunflowers.

props.synopsis: For Pay Day, actor and writer Michelle Brasier talks about getting out of debt through making art, the bread that will be her "financial ruin" and learning not to regret past financial decisions.

title.children: Michelle Brasier went into debt to keep up with rich kids. Here's why she doesn't regret it

image.altText: A logo on a vehicle reads "Queensland police".

props.synopsis: An altercation between two men, aged 38 and 34, happened outside the Townsville Stadium after the Cowboys-Knights game on September 14.

title.children: Police investigate death of man involved in fight after Townsville NRL game

image.altText: A Zimmer frame in focus with a group of aged care residents (unidentifiable) sitting around it.

props.synopsis: The 85-year-old man was found unconscious on the ground beside his wheelchair at a regional Queensland facility in February last year.

title.children: Death of Queensland aged care resident who was left in direct sun was a preventable tragedy, coroner finds

image.altText: A woman holding a young child.

props.synopsis: Medicare is now covering just over half of specialist fees, forcing Australians to increasingly dip into their own pockets and delay vital care.

title.children: Experts warn Medicare rebates for specialists 'almost meaningless'

image.altText: A black man with a beard and glasses looks off to the side

props.synopsis: The 55-year-old was sentenced to death in 2001 for killing Felicia Gayle, a former newspaper reporter found dead in her gated community home.

title.children: Lawyers, prosecutors, jurors and more believed Marcellus Williams may have been innocent. Missouri executed him anyway

image.altText: Joe Daniher celebrates a goal as Nick Blakey looks on

props.synopsis: Joe Daniher will have a major say on whether Brisbane can claim its first premiership since 2004 when he lines up in the grand final on Saturday. It is a role he came very close to playing for the Lions's grand final opponents, Sydney.

title.children: How Brisbane's potential grand final gamebreaker Joe Daniher slipped out of Sydney's grasp twice

image.altText: Sri Lankan Tamil woman Cammy Joseph sitting at a table

props.synopsis: The island nation's new president Anura Dissanayake heralded a "new era of renaissance" as he was sworn in on Monday. Here is how the Sri Lankan diaspora are responding.

title.children: Some Sri Lankans say their new left-wing president is 'a clean guy', but others have mixed feelings

image.altText: a group of people protesting with signs in front of a coal train

props.synopsis: Rising Tide protesters have climbed onto a coal train near Newcastle, calling for the federal government to reverse its approval for three coal mines to extend their operations for another three to four decades.

title.children: Coal train stopped by activists protesting federal approval of NSW mine extensions

image.altText: An electric vehicle by Geely is seen displayed at a car showroom.

props.synopsis: The federal government says it is in contact with the US about the new moves it has put up against Chinese car companies.

title.children: The US government is effectively banning Chinese-made cars from its roads. Some in Australia want the government to take notice

image.altText: Recording artist Sean "Puff Daddy" Combs, ring detail, attends the grand opening weekend at Omnia Nightclub

props.synopsis: Sean “Diddy” Combs has been a revered artist and entrepreneur in the world of hip hop since the early '90s. Now, he’s awaiting trial on charges of sex trafficking and racketeering. How did we get here?

title.children: What’s happening with Diddy? The past, present and future of Sean Combs
